hero.title: Basic Italian Course for Beginners
hero.description: Learn Italian from scratch with a 12-week roadmap: standard pronunciation, foundational grammar, and speaking reflex practice using the shadowing method with native instructors.

highlights: Committed output according to CEFR framework

overview.title: Why start with a basic course?
overview.intro: The A1-A2 course is an important stepping stone to help you grasp the Italian foundation before moving to higher levels. The program combines direct teaching, interactive exercises, and AI pronunciation scoring technology.
overview.bullet1: Build a vocabulary of 600+ words and 60 basic sentence structures
overview.bullet2: Master standard native pronunciation with 1:1 coaching per session
overview.bullet3: Apply immediately through real projects: booking tickets, rooms, writing emails, making calls
overview.roadmapTitle: 70% of time spent on speaking and reflexes
overview.roadmapDesc: Each session consists of 3 parts: Warm-up speaking · Applied grammar · Real-life scenario simulation. Weekend 1:1 coaching sessions to correct pronunciation errors.

journey.title: Kick-off · Weeks 1-2
journey.description: Get familiar with the alphabet, Italian phonemes, and 50 foundational words. Demo speaking test to check mouth positioning.

journey.title: Foundation Building · Weeks 3-6
journey.description: Master sentence structures, present tense, and near past. Practice conversations with real-life scenarios.

journey.title: Real-life Application · Weeks 7-10
journey.description: Small projects: booking flights, hotel rooms, writing emails. 1:1 feedback every session.

journey.title: Acceleration & Testing · Weeks 11-12
journey.description: CEFR mock tests, AI pronunciation assessment, roadmap consultation for A2/B1 levels.

courses.sectionTitle: Choose a basic course suitable for your goals
courses.sectionDesc: We clearly distinguish between A1 (foundation) and A2 (applied) to help you easily orient your next learning path.

A1.title: Foundational Italian A1
A1.description: Learn pronunciation, vocabulary, and basic sentence structures to communicate confidently in daily life.
A1.outcome2: Understand and ask simple questions (What, Where, Who...)

A2.title: Applied Italian A2
A2.description: Accelerate communication skills, understand longer content, and react naturally in many situations.
A2.outcome2: Communicate confidently in travel and basic work
A2.outcome3: Write emails, short paragraphs with correct grammar

benefits.title: We are with you every step of the way
benefits.item1Desc: 100% of tutors achieve at least C2 level and have teaching certificates, supporting both Vietnamese and Italian.
benefits.item2Desc: Learn anytime with an app: flashcards, listening exercises, AI pronunciation scoring with IPA standards.
benefits.item3Desc: Free mock tests, free retakes if the committed target is not reached.
benefits.item4Desc: Join weekly Italian speaking clubs and receive a mentor to accompany you.

testimonials.title: What students say about the basic level?

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions for Basic Italian
faq.subtitle: If you have any further questions, leave your information for more detailed mentor consultation.
faq.q1: I don't know anything about Italian, can I study?
faq.a1: Absolutely! The basic course is for those with no foundation. You will learn pronunciation from scratch and have mentor support when self-studying at home.
faq.a2: Students receive a PDF curriculum + workbook + online flashcards. 1:1 classes also receive a personalized study schedule.
faq.q3: Can I postpone my studies if I'm busy?
faq.a3: You can postpone for up to 03 months and still maintain access to materials and the practice app during this time.
faq.a4: 1:1 classes are fully personalized with flexible schedules, while 3-student classes increase group interaction and optimize costs.

cta.title: Ready to start your Italian journey?

overview.title: From A2 foundation to confident B1/B2 in 12 weeks

overview.bullet2: 8 projects simulating real meetings with video feedback

overview.workshopTitle: Debate Lab · Business Pitch · Academic Writing

journey.title: Gap Analysis · Weeks 1-2

journey.title: Skill Acceleration · Weeks 3-6

journey.title: Practical Projects · Weeks 7-10

journey.title: Exam Prep & Certification · Weeks 11-12
journey.description: 2 mock tests, private coaching for each skill, guidance on CELI/CILS registration.

faq.title: Solving questions about the intermediate course
faq.subtitle: Send us your questions if you need more detailed advice on certification, visas, or career orientation.
faq.q1: Can I study without an A2 certificate?
faq.a1: If you have studied at least 200 hours of Italian or have evidence of basic communication ability, we will organize a placement test to assign a suitable class.
faq.q2: Does the course include B1/B2 exam prep?
faq.a2: Yes. In the last 4 weeks, students practice complete exam papers, scored according to the official rubric, and receive registration guidance.
faq.q3: Is there support for job searching or studying abroad?
faq.a3: For students who complete B2 with a speaking score > 80, we have a network of mentors to help with interview preparation and study abroad profiles.
faq.q4: What if I miss a class?
faq.a4: 1:1 classes can make up for up to 4 sessions per course. Group classes will have recordings and mentors will recap important content.

faq.title: Q&A about the advanced program
faq.subtitle: We are always ready to advise if you need more information on exams, educational visas, or career orientation.
faq.q1: What are the entry requirements for C1/C2 classes?
faq.a1: You need to complete at least B2 or pass a placement test including speaking + writing to ensure readiness for the intensive program.
faq.q2: Does the course support thesis writing or academic portfolios?
faq.a2: Yes. Mentors support critiquing outlines, editing style, and standardizing documents according to school/unit requirements.
faq.q3: Can I participate if I don't take the exam?
faq.a3: Absolutely. You can choose a specialized path (business, diplomatic, academic) and complete a capstone project instead.
faq.q4: Is there a program to study in Italy?
faq.a4: Students who reach C1 or above can register for a 2-week short trip in Italy to practice with native speakers (additional cost).
